area_1_x.desc: Only units on this selected area will be affected by the effect.

attack_stance.desc: Set the new stance of the unit, aggressive, defensive, stand ground or no attack

button_location.desc: The location of the button for a unit or technology. This number is given by $(row-1)\times5+column$. For example, the button location for the man at arms **research** in the barracks, which is in the 2nd row and 1st column, is given by $(2-1)\times5+1 = 6$

diplomacy.desc: The new diplomacy state of the players TODO

display_time.desc: The amount of time to display the instruction for

enabled_or_victory.desc: If this is selected, the units/technology is enabled if it is not already enabled
If this is selected, the chosen player will win the game. If it is not selected, then the chosen player is defeated

facet.desc: The rotation of the created unit

flash_object.desc: This will flare the converted units TODO

food.desc: The new food cost of the unit/technology

force_research_technology.desc: If this is enabled, then the technology is researched even if the player's civilization does not have access to it

gold.desc: The new Gold cost of the unit/technology

instruction_panel_position.desc: Position 0 displays the instruction at the top, Position 1 displays the instruction in the middle of the top half of the screen and Position 2 displays the instruction at the bottom of the top half of the screen

item_id.desc: The kind of unit to apply the effect to

location_x.desc: The location to create the unit on, or task a unit to

message.desc: The message/instruction to show on screen or the script call to execute

object_attributes.desc: The attribute of a unit to modify

object_group.desc: This is the group/category of units to effect TODO

object_type.desc: This is the class of the units to effect

operation.desc: Add, Subtract, Multiply or Divide the given quantity

player_color.desc: The new colour of the unit

scroll.desc: If this is enabled, changing the camera to a new position shows a scrolling animation from the position the player was previously on. If not enabled, the camera cuts to the new position wihout any animations.

selected_object.desc: The units to apply the effect to

sound_name.desc: The name of the sound to play

source_player.desc: The player that is affected by the effect

stone.desc: The new stone cost of the unit/technology

string_id.desc: This is the same as the `Name String ID`. Refer to topic 5.8 of the `Scenario Basics` section of the guide

target_player.desc: This is the second player that is affected by an effect

time_unit.desc: Which unit is the time specified in? This can be seconds, minutes or years TODO

variable_or_timer.desc: The time to display the message for

wood.desc: The new wood cost of the unit/technology
